Description: Fragment of textile (bag or hood) of undyed, plain weave linen with red wool bands; A rectangle is folded over and sewn across one end, the seam decorated with an applied double cord of red wool; At the open end, there is a channel with the remains of a red wool draw string; No side seam preserved; Warp?: linen, c.21 tpc, mixed S and Z spun, no clear pattern; Weft?: linen mainly Z spun but some S spun, wool S spun, c.21 tpc; Edges: short lengths of two plain selvedges (near ends of channel), other edges hidden or ragged; Sewing: in S spun Z ply linen thread.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, small grey box. The red may be in the warp rather than the weft, compare a fragment from Qasr Ibrim (EA ref no.) with a red silk stripe parallel to the selvedge. Mixture of spin directions points to a dating around the time spin direction in Egypt was changing from S to Z, c.15th century A.D.? Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (11.6.1990)
Condition: Poor; fragmentary. At unknown date stuck to sticky net.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
